title: Understanding the zero exponent rule
text: The zero exponent rule states that any non-zero base raised to the power of zero is always equal to $$1$$.

title: Simplifying a single term
text: In this problem, expressions like $$w^4$$ mean w to the power of $$4$$.

title: Simplifying the expression
text: When you divide exponents with the same base, you subtract the exponents. For example, $$a^m$$ divided by $$a^n$$ is $$a^{m-n}$$.

title: Simplifying with subtraction of exponents
text: In the expression $$\frac{w^4 w^2}{w^6}$$, combine $$w^4$$ and $$w^2$$ by adding their exponents to get $$w^{4+2}$$. What do you get after combining these terms?

title: Final simplification
text: Now, using the simplified form $$\frac{w^6}{w^6}$$, recall the zero exponent rule to simplify further.

title: Applying the final simplification
text: What is the result when any non-zero term is divided by itself, such as $$\frac{w^6}{w^6}$$?
